SEARCH
Package grafiosch.common

Class CSVImportHelper

java.lang.Object
grafiosch.common.CSVImportHelper
public class CSVImportHelper extends Object
Utility class providing common CSV import functionality for mapping CSV headers to entity fields and parsing CSV data lines into entity objects.

This class supports flexible header-to-field mapping using annotations to determine which entity fields are importable. It handles:

  • Dynamic header mapping based on PropertyAlwaysUpdatable and PropertyOnlyCreation annotations
  • Required field validation using annotation
  • Value conversion for different data types (dates, numbers, strings)
  • Uppercase conversion for string fields when configured

Example CSV format: 

 isin;tickerSymbol;currency
 US0378331005;AAPL;USD
 DE0007164600;SAP;EUR

  • Method Details

    • getHeaderFieldNameMapping

      public static List<FieldColumnMapping> getHeaderFieldNameMapping(String headerLine, Class<?> entityClass, User user)
      Creates a mapping between CSV column headers and entity fields based on annotations.

      This method inspects the target entity class for fields annotated with PropertyAlwaysUpdatable or PropertyOnlyCreation, then matches them against the CSV header columns. Fields annotated with ImportDataRequired are marked as required in the mapping.

      Header matching is case-sensitive and matches the end of field names to allow for flexible naming conventions (e.g., "ticker_symbol" matches field "tickerSymbol" if the field name ends with the header value after trimming).

      Parameters:
      headerLine - the CSV header line containing column names separated by CSV_FIELD_SEPARATOR
      entityClass - the target entity class to map columns to
      user - the current user (used for locale in error messages)
      Returns:
      list of FieldColumnMapping objects representing the column-to-field mappings
      Throws:
      DataViolationException - if a required field (annotated with ImportDataRequired) is not found in the CSV headers

    • getHeaderFieldNameMapping

      public static List<FieldColumnMapping> getHeaderFieldNameMapping(String headerLine, Class<?> entityClass, User user, Set<Class<? extends Annotation>> importableAnnotations)
      Creates a mapping between CSV column headers and entity fields based on custom annotations.

      This overload allows specifying custom annotation classes to determine which fields are importable, providing flexibility for different import scenarios.

      Parameters:
      headerLine - the CSV header line containing column names separated by CSV_FIELD_SEPARATOR
      entityClass - the target entity class to map columns to
      user - the current user (used for locale in error messages)
      importableAnnotations - set of annotation classes that mark fields as importable
      Returns:
      list of FieldColumnMapping objects representing the column-to-field mappings
      Throws:
      DataViolationException - if a required field (annotated with ImportDataRequired) is not found in the CSV headers

    • parseLineToEntity

      public static <T> void parseLineToEntity(String line, int lineNumber, T entity, List<FieldColumnMapping> fieldColumnMappings, ValueFormatConverter valueFormatConverter, boolean uppercaseStrings, User user)
      Parses a CSV data line and populates an entity object using the provided field mappings.

      This method handles value conversion for different data types using the provided ValueFormatConverter. Empty values are skipped unless the field is marked as required. String values can optionally be converted to uppercase.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the entity type
      Parameters:
      line - the CSV data line to parse
      lineNumber - the line number in the CSV file (used for error messages)
      entity - the entity instance to populate
      fieldColumnMappings - the column-to-field mappings from getHeaderFieldNameMapping(java.lang.String, java.lang.Class<?>, grafiosch.entities.User)
      valueFormatConverter - converter for handling date and number formats (can be null for simple string fields)
      uppercaseStrings - if true, string values are converted to uppercase
      user - the current user (used for locale in error messages)
      Throws:
      DataViolationException - if a value cannot be converted to the target field type

    • splitCSVLine

      public static String[] splitCSVLine(String line)
      Splits a CSV line using the standard separator.
      Parameters:
      line - the CSV line to split
      Returns:
      array of field values
